author: Tyler Sullivan
title: Fantasy focus
text:
Each Sunday during the NFL season, the Herald provides its ideal lineup for daily fantasy football players.
Here are our best bets for Week 5:
SALARY CAP: $50,000
•   QB: Phillip Rivers, Chargers vs. Steelers ($6,200) — The NFL leader in passing yards against a shaky Pittsburgh secondary.
•    RB: Le’Veon Bell, Steelers at Chargers ($8,500) — San Diego has allowed either 100 yards or a TD to opposing RBs in each game.
•    RB: Dion Lewis, Patriots at Cowboys ($4,800) — Look for Tom Brady and Lewis to mimic what Brees and C.J. Spiller did vs. Dallas last week.
•    WR: Kamar Aiken, Ravens vs. Browns ($3,800) — If Aiken can do half of what Steve Smith Sr. did, he’ll be a steal.
•      WR: Keenan Allen, Chargers vs. Steelers ($7,200) — Should be a field day vs. this secondary. Big reception total coming.
•     WR: Julian Edelman, Patriots at Cowboys ($7,000) — Like all rival defenses, Dallas will focus on Gronk, leaving Edelman room to roam.
•     TE: Charles Clay, Bills at Titans ($4,100) — Tyrod Taylor’s go-to-guy has either had a TD or 100 yards receiving in the last three games.
•    Flex: Todd Gurley, Rams at Packers ($4,300) — Should go bonkers vs. a ‘D’ allowing 4.8 yards a carry.
•      D/ST: Giants vs. 49ers ($2,900) — At home and going up against turnover-happy Colin Kaepernick.
